findings.title: Write permission on sensitive scope: security-events
findings.description: The job:security grants write access to 'security-events'. This is a sensitive permission that should be carefully reviewed.
findings.remediation: Verify that write access to 'security-events' is truly required. Consider using read-only access if writes aren't needed.

findings.title: Action 'codecov/codecov-action@v4' not pinned to SHA
findings.description: The action 'codecov/codecov-action' uses version 'v4' which is a mutable tag. Tags can be moved to point to different commits, potentially introducing malicious code.
findings.remediation:
Pin the action to a specific SHA:
uses: codecov/codecov-action@<full-commit-sha>  # v4

You can find the SHA by checking the action's releases on GitHub.

findings.title: Action from unverified source: codecov
findings.description: The action 'codecov/codecov-action@v4' is from 'codecov' which is not a verified GitHub Actions publisher. While this doesn't mean the action is malicious, extra caution is advised.
findings.remediation: Review the action's source code at https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action to ensure it's trustworthy. Consider forking the action to your organization for added control.

findings.title: pip install without hash verification
findings.description: Python dependencies are being installed without hash verification. This means the integrity of downloaded packages isn't verified.
findings.remediation:
Use pip with hash checking:
1. Generate hashes: pip-compile --generate-hashes
2. Install with: pip install --require-hashes -r requirements.txt

findings.title: Workflow meets SLSA Level 2 but not Level 3
findings.description: This workflow meets SLSA Level 2 but lacks Level 3 requirements for hardened builds and signed provenance.
findings.remediation:
To meet SLSA Level 3:
1. Use GitHub-hosted runners (ephemeral environment)
2. Consider using container jobs for isolation
3. Generate signed provenance using:
   - slsa-framework/slsa-github-generator
   - actions/attest-build-provenance
4. Enable artifact signing

findings.title: Build workflow without provenance generation
findings.description: This appears to be a build or release workflow but does not generate SLSA provenance. Provenance provides a tamper-proof record of how artifacts were built.
findings.remediation:
Consider using the official SLSA provenance generator:
1. slsa-framework/slsa-github-generator
2. actions/attest-build-provenance

These create signed provenance attestations for your artifacts.

findings.title: Job 'test' has network access without isolation
findings.description: This job appears to make network requests but doesn't use container isolation. For SLSA Level 3+, consider using containerized builds with explicit network policies.
findings.remediation:
Consider:
1. Using a container for the job
2. Pre-caching dependencies
3. Using a network-restricted environment
